sen.j: 姉川の戦い（あねがわのたたかい）は、戦国時代 (日本)の元亀元年6月28日 (旧暦)（1570年8月9日）（ユリウス暦1570年7月30日）に近江国浅井郡姉川河原（現在の滋賀県長浜市野村町（旧：東浅井郡浅井町野村 域）付近）で行われた合戦である。
sen.e: The Battle of Anegawa refers to the battle which took place in the region around Anegawa kawara, Asai-gun, Omi Province (the present Nomura-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture (around former Nomura, Asai-machi, Higashiasai-gun)) on August 9, 1570 during the Warring States Period.

The Battle of Anegawa refers to the battle which took place in the region around Anegawa kawara, Azai-gun, Omi Province (the present Nomura-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture (around former Nomura, Azai-machi, Higashiasai-gun)) on August 9, 1570 during the Warring States Period.

The Battle of Anegawa refers to the battle which took place in the region around Anegawa kawara, Azai-gun, Omi Province (the present Nomura-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture (around former Nomura, Azai-machi, Higashiasai-gun)) on August 9, 1570 during the Warring States Period.

sen.j: 因みに、当時は織田、浅井方ともこの合戦を「野村合戦」と、朝倉方では「三田村合戦」と呼称していた。
sen.e: Both Oda and Asai sides called this battle "Nomura battle" while Asakura side called it "Mitamura battle".
Both Oda and Azai sides called this battle "Nomura battle" while Asakura side called it "Mitamura battle".
Both Oda and Azai sides called this battle 'Nomura battle' while Asakura side called it 'Mitamura battle.'

sen.j: 「姉川の合戦」は徳川家における呼称である。
sen.e: The name "the Battle of Anegawa" was exclusively used by the Tokugawa family.
The name "the Battle of Anegawa" was exclusively used by the Tokugawa family.
The name 'the Battle of Anegawa' was exclusively used by the Tokugawa family.

sen.j: 『信長公記』などに合戦の記述があるが、簡潔な内容にとどまる資料が多く、合戦の詳細については不明な部分が多い。
sen.e: The descriptions of the battle can be found in the book "Nobunaga's biography", but many of them have only brief materials and have a lot of unclear details on the battle.
The descriptions of the battle can be found in the book "Nobunaga's biography", but many of them have only brief materials and have a lot of unclear details on the battle.
The descriptions of the battle can be found in the book "Nobunaga's biography", but many of them have only brief materials and have a lot of unclear details on the battle.

sen.j: 尾張国（愛知県西部）出身の戦国大名である織田信長は、駿河国の今川氏を撃退し、斎藤氏から美濃国を奪取したのち、上洛を目的として近江に侵攻した。
sen.e: Nobunaga ODA, a feudal lord from Owari Province (the western part of Aichi Prefecture), fought off the Imagawa clan of Suruga Province and seized Mino Province from the Saito clan, then they invaded Omi in order to go to the capital.

Nobunaga ODA, a feudal lord from Owari Province (the western part of Aichi Prefecture), fought off the Imagawa clan of Suruga Province and seized Mino Province from the Saito clan, then they invaded Omi in order to go to the capital.

Nobunaga ODA, a feudal lord from Owari Province (the western part of Aichi Prefecture), fought off the Imagawa clan of Suruga Province and seized Mino Province from the Saito clan, then they invaded Omi in order to go to the capital.

sen.j: 侵攻に先立ち、北近江を治める浅井長政には、妹であるお市の方を娶らせて織田氏との縁戚関係を結んでいた。
sen.e: Prior to the invasion, Nagamasa ASAI, who governed Kitaomi, had his sister Lady Oichi marry to the Oda clan so he could establish a relationship with the clan.
Prior to the invasion, he had his sister Lady Oichi marry to Nagamasa AZAI, who governed Kitaomi, to establish a relationship between the Azai and the Oda clan.
sen.cmt: Asai → Azai原文に沿って修正をしました。
sen.e: Prior to the invasion, he had his sister Lady Oichi marry to Nagamasa AZAI, who governed Kitaomi, to establish a relationship between the Azai and the Oda clan.

sen.j: 信長は、浅井氏からも援軍を得て、共通の敵である南近江の有力大名である六角義賢親子を破り（観音寺城の戦い）、足利義昭を奉じての上洛を果たした。
sen.e: Gaining reinforcements from the Asai clan, Nobunaga defeated Yoshikata ROKKAKU parent and child, who were powerful feudal lords of Minami Omi and also a common enemy of Nobunaga and the Asai clan (the Battle of Kannonji Castle), and accomplished to go to the capital under Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA.

Gaining reinforcements from the Aｚai clan, Nobunaga defeated Yoshikata ROKKAKU parent and child, who were powerful feudal lords of Minami Omi and also a common enemy of Nobunaga and the Aｚai clan (the Battle of Kannonji Castle), and accomplished to go to the capital under Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA.

Gaining reinforcements from the Aｚai clan, Nobunaga defeated Yoshikata ROKKAKU parent and child, who were powerful feudal lords of Minami Omi and also a common enemy of Nobunaga and the Aｚai clan (the Battle of Kannonji Castle), and accomplished to go to the capital under Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: その後、信長からの上洛参集要求などを拒んで対立した越前国の朝倉氏に対し、元亀元年（1570年）4月には信長が越前への侵攻を開始すると、朝倉との縁（同盟関係、主従関係とも）も深かった長政は信長から離反し、織田軍の背後を襲った。
sen.e: Later, because, in April 1570, Nobunaga started invading Echizen Province against the Asai clan of the province, who refused his demands such as gathering for going to the capital and came to have a conflict with him, Nagamasa, who had close relationship (alliance and lord-vassal relationship) with Asakura, seceded from Nobunaga and attacked Oda troops from behind.

Later, because, in June 1570, Nobunaga started invading Echizen Province against the Azai clan of the province, who refused his demands such as gathering for going to the capital and came to have a conflict with him, Nagamasa, who had also close relationship (alliance and lord-vassal relationship) with Asakura, seceded from Nobunaga and attacked Oda troops from behind.
sen.cmt: 和暦→グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。Asai → Azaialso 追加しました
sen.e: Later, because, in June 1570, Nobunaga started invading Echizen Province against the Azai clan of the province, who refused his demands such as gathering for going to the capital and came to have a conflict with him, Nagamasa, who had also close relationship (alliance and lord-vassal relationship) with Asakura, seceded from Nobunaga and attacked Oda troops from behind.

sen.j: 優位から一転、突如挟撃された信長は危険な状況に陥ったが、「金ヶ崎の戦い」と呼ばれる配下たちの決死の退却戦によって、一命を救われている。
sen.e: The dominant situation completely changed and Nobunaga plunged into crisis after being pincer-attacked suddenly; however, he was barely saved by so-called Battle of Kanagasaki which was a desperate retreat battle of his vassals.

The dominant situation completely changed and Nobunaga plunged into crisis after being pincer-attacked suddenly; however, he was barely saved by so-called Battle of Kanagasaki which was a desperate retreat battle of his vassals.

The dominant situation completely changed and Nobunaga plunged into crisis after being pincer-attacked suddenly; however, he was barely saved by so-called 'Battle of Kanagasaki' which was a desperate retreat battle of his vassals.

sen.j: 信長は、この報復戦のために軍備を整えると北近江へ出陣。
sen.e: Nobunaga armed for this retaliation battle and moved up to Kitaomi.
Nobunaga armed for this retaliation battle and moved up to Kitaomi.
Nobunaga armed for this retaliation battle and moved up to Kitaomi.

sen.j: その軍力を恐れた坂田郡の堀秀村などが信長に降った。
sen.e: Warriors such as Hidemura HORI of Sakata-gun who were afraid of his military power sold out to Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: 「降った」とあるのは「寝返る」と読み替えて訳しました。
sen.e: Warriors such as Hidemura HORI of Sakata-gun who were afraid of his military power sold out to Nobunaga.
Warriors such as Hidemura HORI of Sakata-gun who were afraid of his military power sold out to Nobunaga.

sen.j: 浅井氏の本拠である小谷城へ迫る織田軍に対して朝倉義景は一族の朝倉景健を総大将とする兵を派遣した。
sen.e: Yoshikage ASAKURA dispatched troops led by one of his clans Kagetake ASAKURA as supreme commander to Oda troops that were coming up to Odani-jo Castle which was the base of the Asai clan.
Yoshikage ASAKURA dispatched troops led by one of his clans Kagetake ASAKURA as supreme commander to Oda troops that were coming up to Odani-jo Castle which was the base of the Aｚai clan.
Yoshikage ASAKURA dispatched troops led by one of his clans Kagetake ASAKURA as supreme commander to Oda troops that were coming up to Odani-jo Castle which was the base of the Aｚai clan.

sen.j: 一方で6月27日 (旧暦)には、信長へも徳川家康軍が参着。
sen.e: On the other hand, the troops of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA arrived at Nobunaga's on June 27.
On the other hand, the troops of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA arrived at Nobunaga's on August 8.
On the other hand, the troops of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA arrived at Nobunaga's on August 8.

sen.j: 翌28日、姉川河原で織田信長・徳川家康の連合軍28,000（27,000、30,000とする説もあり）と、浅井・朝倉同盟軍18,000（17,000とする説もあり）が琵琶湖へ注ぐ姉川を挟んで戦った。
sen.e: The next day 28th, allied forces of 28,000 (a theory says they were 27,000 or 30,000) of Nobunaga ODA and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA fought with those of 18,000 (a theory says they were 17,000) of Asai and Asakura across Anegawa River emptying into Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: 「姉川河原で」は最後の「姉川を挟んで戦った」と重複するので訳していません。
sen.e: The next day 28th, allied forces of 28,000 (a theory says they were 27,000 or 30,000) of Nobunaga ODA and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA fought with those of 18,000 (a theory says they were 17,000) of Azai and Asakura across Anegawa River emptying into Lake Biwa.

The next day 9th, allied forces of 28,000 (a theory says they were 27,000 or 30,000) of Nobunaga ODA and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA fought with those of 18,000 (a theory says they were 17,000) of Azai and Asakura across Anegawa River emptying into Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 戦闘は平地戦で、徳川軍は朝倉軍と、織田軍は浅井軍と対峙した。
sen.e: The battle took place in level ground where Tokugawa troops faced Asakura while Oda faced Asai.
The battle took place in level ground where Tokugawa troops faced Asakura while Oda faced Azai.
The battle took place in level ground where Tokugawa troops faced Asakura while Oda faced Azai.

sen.j: 徳川方の酒井忠次、小笠原信興の隊が朝倉軍に攻撃したのを皮切りに合戦が開始された。
sen.e: First, the troops of Tadatsugu SAKAI and Nobuoki OGASAWARA from Tokugawa side attacked Asakura troops, then the battle broke out.
First, the troops of Tadatsugu SAKAI and Nobuoki OGASAWARA from Tokugawa side attacked Asakura troops, then the battle broke out.
First, the troops of Tadatsugu SAKAI and Nobuoki OGASAWARA from Tokugawa side attacked Asakura troops, then the battle broke out.

sen.j: 兵力的には劣る朝倉・浅井両軍であったが、浅井側先鋒磯野員昌率いる浅井家精鋭部隊が織田方先鋒坂井政尚、続いて池田恒興、豊臣秀吉、柴田勝家の陣を次々に突破し13段の備えのうち実に11段までを打ち破る猛攻を見せた。
sen.e: Although Asakura and Asai troops were understrength, Asai's elite troops led by its top Kazumasa ISONO broke through those of Oda's top Masahisa SAKAI, Tsuneoki IKEDA, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Katsuie SHIBATA one after another, and in fact, they launched fierce attacks to knock down eleven out of thirteen layers of military reserves.

Although Asakura and Azai troops were understrength, Azai's elite troops led by its top Kazumasa ISONO broke through those of Oda's top Masahisa SAKAI, Tsuneoki IKEDA, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Katsuie SHIBATA one after another, and in fact, they launched fierce attacks to knock down eleven out of thirteen layers of military reserves.

Although Asakura and Azai troops were understrength, Azai's elite troops led by its top Kazumasa ISONO broke through those of Oda's top Masahisa SAKAI, Tsuneoki IKEDA, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Katsuie SHIBATA one after another, and in fact, they launched fierce attacks to knock down eleven out of thirteen layers of military reserves.

sen.j: その激戦ぶりは、「火花を散らし戦ひければ、敵味方の分野は、伊勢をの海士の潜きして息つぎあへぬ風情なり」と伝えられるほどであった。
sen.e: Those attacks were fierce enough to be described as follows: "In fierce attacks, friend or foe, Ise divers dive into the sea, gives me a feeling, breathing in their own way, "
Those attacks were fierce enough to be described as follows: "In fierce attacks, friend or foe, Ise divers dive into the sea, gives me a feeling, breathing in their own way, "
Those attacks were fierce enough to be described as follows: 'In fierce attacks, friend or foe, Ise divers dive into the sea, gives me a feeling, breathing in their own way.'

sen.j: しかし、織田側後詰として横山城の抑えについていた稲葉良通らが援軍にかけつけ危機を救う。
sen.e: However, Yoshimichi INABA, who surrounded Yokoyama-jo Castle as a Oda's rear guard, and other warriors rushed to help save them from the crisis.
However, Yoshimichi INABA, who surrounded Yokoyama-jo Castle as a Oda's rear guard, and other warriors rushed to help save them from the crisis.
However, Yoshimichi INABA, who surrounded Yokoyama-jo Castle as a Oda's rear guard, and other warriors rushed to help save them from the crisis.

sen.j: 一方、徳川軍と交戦していた朝倉軍は数では上回っていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, Asakura troops, which were fighting with Tokugawa, were outnumbered.
On the other hand, Asakura troops, which were fighting with Tokugawa, outnumbered the Tokugawa troop.
On the other hand, Asakura troops, which were fighting with Tokugawa, outnumbered the Tokugawa troop.

sen.j: しかし、理由は不明だが朝倉義景が前線に出なかったため士気に欠けた。
sen.e: However, Yoshikage ASAKURA did not move into the front due to unexplained reason, which wore down the morale.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Yoshikage ASAKURA did not move into the front due to unexplained reason, which wore down the morale.
However, Yoshikage ASAKURA did not move into the front due to unexplained reason, which wore down the morale.

sen.j: 徳川軍は苦戦しつつも正面突破を強行した本多忠勝や、迂回して朝倉勢を横撃した榊原康政の2将が率いる徳川旗本精鋭隊が加わり、徳川家康の本隊がこれに加わったことで遂に朝倉軍は敗れ去った。
sen.e: Tokugawa's hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) elite troops led by two leaders, Tadakatsu HONDA, who burst through head-on forcibly while having a tough time, and Yasumasa SAKAKIBARA, who went the way around to attack Asakura forces from the side, joined Tokugawa troops, and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's main force followed them, which caused Asakura forces to lose out at last.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。 旗本の訳に（ ）を補足した。
sen.e: Tokugawa's hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) elite troops led by two leaders, Tadakatsu HONDA, who burst through head-on forcibly while having a tough time, and Yasumasa SAKAKIBARA, who went the way around to attack Asakura forces from the side, joined Tokugawa troops, and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's main force followed them, which caused Asakura forces to lose out at last.

Tokugawa's hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) elite troops led by two leaders, Tadakatsu HONDA, who burst through head-on forcibly while having a tough time, and Yasumasa SAKAKIBARA, who went the way around to attack Asakura forces from the side, joined Tokugawa troops, and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's main force followed them, which caused Asakura forces to lose out at last.

sen.j: 徳川方に参加していた稲葉一鉄、更に横山城を攻めていた氏家卜全、安藤守就らが織田軍の増援として駆けつけ、浅井軍の無防備な側面を突くと浅井軍も右翼から崩れ始めた。
sen.e: Ittetsu INABA, who had belonged to Tokugawa side, and others such as Bokuzen UJIIE and Morinari ANDO, who had been attacking Yokoyama-jo Castle, rushed over there to reinforce Oda troops and attacked Asai's vulnerable side, which eventually made Asai troops start collapsing from its right side.

Ittetsu INABA, who had belonged to Tokugawa side, and others such as Bokuzen UJIIE and Morinari ANDO, who had been attacking Yokoyama-jo Castle, rushed over there to reinforce Oda troops and attacked Azai's vulnerable side, which eventually made Azai troops start collapsing from its right side.

Ittetsu INABA, who had belonged to Tokugawa side, and others such as Bokuzen UJIIE and Morinari ANDO, who had been attacking Yokoyama-jo Castle, rushed over there to reinforce Oda troops and attacked Azai's vulnerable side, which eventually made Azai troops start collapsing from its right side.

sen.j: 浅井・朝倉両軍は北国往還道へ敗走を余儀なくされ、
sen.e: Both Asai and Asakura troops were forced to flee to the Hokkoku Okan Highway.
Both Azai and Asakura troops were forced to flee to the Hokkoku Okan Highway.
Both Azai and Asakura troops were forced to flee to the Hokkoku Okan Highway.

sen.j: 追撃により多数の戦死者を出す結果となった。
sen.e: Consequently, chase attacks caused a number of casualties.
Consequently, chase attacks caused a number of casualties.
Consequently, chase attacks caused a number of casualties.

sen.j: 戦闘は午前5時に始まり午後2時まで続いたと伝えられており、死者は浅井朝倉方で1800人、織田徳川方で800人、負傷者は各方その3倍と推定されている。
sen.e: It is said that the battle started at five in the morning and lasted until two in the afternoon, and the estimated death toll was 1,800 on Asai and Asakura sides and 800 on Oda and Tokugawa sides, and the wounded was three times as much on each side.

It is said that the battle started at five in the morning and lasted until two in the afternoon, and the estimated death toll was 1,800 on Azai and Asakura sides and 800 on Oda and Tokugawa sides, and the wounded was three times as much on each side.

It is said that the battle started at five in the morning and lasted until two in the afternoon, and the estimated death toll was 1,800 on Azai and Asakura sides and 800 on Oda and Tokugawa sides, and the wounded was three times as much on each side.

sen.j: 合戦場付近の「血原」「血川」という地名は往時の激戦振りを窺わせる。
sen.e: The names of places "chibara" and "chigawa", which were located near the battle field, suggest fierce battle in old times.
The names of places "chibara" and "chigawa", which were located near the battle field, suggest fierce battle in old times.
The names of places 'chibara' and 'chigawa,' which were located near the battle field, suggest fierce battle in old times.

sen.j: 磯野員昌の活躍についての諸説
sen.e: Various theories on Kazumasa ISONO's performance
Various theories on Kazumasa ISONO's performance
Various theories on Kazumasa ISONO's performance

sen.j: 員昌の11段崩しの話については諸説ある。
sen.e: There are various theories about his eleven-layers break.
There are various theories about his eleven-layer break.
There are various theories about his eleven-layer break.

sen.j: 活躍否定説
sen.e: Negative theory on his achievement
Negative theory on his achievement
Negative theory on his achievement

sen.j: 徳川家が長政の娘（崇源院）を娶っている関係上、徳川家の意により後に浅井側の活躍を誇張したもので実際は始めから織田側が圧倒していたとする説。
sen.e: A theory suggests that because Nagamasa's daughter (Sugenin) had married to one in the Tokugawa clan, later the performance of Asai side was exaggerated deliberately by the Tokugawa clan and, in reality, Oda side overwhelmed Asai from the beginning.

A theory suggests that because Nagamasa's daughter (Sugenin) had married to one in the Tokugawa clan, later the performance of Azai side was exaggerated deliberately by the Tokugawa clan and, in reality, Oda side overwhelmed Azai from the beginning.

A theory suggests that because Nagamasa's daughter (Sugenin) had married to one in the Tokugawa clan, later the performance of Azai side was exaggerated deliberately by the Tokugawa clan and, in reality, Oda side overwhelmed Azai from the beginning.

sen.j: 徳川軍の活躍により合戦に勝利したことを示すため織田軍が押され気味であったと記述しているとする説。
sen.e: A theory suggests that there was a description that Oda troops were losing ground in order to indicate that they won the battle because of the performance of Tokugawa's.
A theory suggests that there was a description that Oda troops were losing ground in order to indicate that they won the battle because of the performance of Tokugawa's.
A theory suggests that there was a description that Oda troops were losing ground in order to indicate that they won the battle because of the performance of Tokugawa's.

sen.j: 上記に類似するが、後に織田家の権力を乗っ取った徳川家としては、信長を一流の武将でないと喧伝する必要があり、その事情から織田軍の劣勢を強調する必要があったとする説。
sen.e: Similar to the above, a theory suggests that, for the Tokugawa clan, which took over the authority of the Oda clan, it was necessary to trumpet Nobunaga as not a top grade samurai, and in the light of the circumstances, they had to emphasize Oda troops was on the backfoot.

Similar to the above, a theory suggests that, for the Tokugawa clan, which took over the authority of the Oda clan, it was necessary to trumpet Nobunaga as not a top grade samurai, and in the light of the circumstances, they had to emphasize Oda troops was on the backfoot.

Similar to the above, a theory suggests that, for the Tokugawa clan, which took over the authority of the Oda clan, it was necessary to trumpet Nobunaga as not a top grade samurai, and in the light of the circumstances, they had to emphasize Oda troops was on the backfoot.

sen.j: 上記のように戦死者は織田徳川方で800人、負傷者はその3倍であるとすれば、11段もの陣を崩したにしては織田軍の戦傷者が少なすぎるとする説。
sen.e: A theory suggests that, as above stated, if the war death was 800 on Oda and Tokugawa sides and the wounded three times as much as the former, the war wounded of Oda's was too low for their successful attacks on eleven-layers reserves.

A theory suggests that, as above stated, if the war death was 800 on Oda and Tokugawa sides and the wounded three times as much as the former, the war wounded of Oda's was too low for their successful attacks on eleven-layer reserves.

sen.j: 活躍肯定説
sen.e: Affirmative theory on his achievement
Affirmative theory on his achievement
Affirmative theory on his achievement

sen.j: 斎藤氏美濃斎藤氏や本願寺との戦いでも苦戦していた織田軍であるから浅井軍との戦いに苦戦していても何らおかしくはないとする説。
sen.e: A theory suggests that it was no wonder that Oda troops fought an uphill battle against Asai troops because they fought the same against the Saito clan, the Saito clan of Mino, and Hongan-ji Temple,
A theory suggests that it was no wonder that Oda troops fought an uphill battle against Azai troops because they fought the same against the Saito clan of Mino, and Hongan-ji Temple,
sen.cmt: Asai → Azai 原文で斉藤氏が重複していますので訳で修正しました。（wikipediaでは修正されています）
sen.e: A theory suggests that it was no wonder that Oda troops fought an uphill battle against Azai troops because they fought the same against the Saito clan of Mino, and Hongan-ji Temple,

sen.j: 数に劣る浅井・朝倉軍が織田軍に対して夜襲を仕掛け浮き足立っていたが徳川や横山城からの救援により敵軍を撤退させたという説。
sen.e: A theory suggests that Asai and Asakura troops, which were outnumbered by Oda's, provoked a night attack against Oda troops and were backing away from them, but they made the enemy retreat with the back-up troops from Tokugawa and Yokoyama-jo Castle.

A theory suggests that Asai and Asakura troops, which were outnumbered by Oda's, provoked a night attack against Oda troops and were backing away from them, but they made the enemy retreat with the back-up troops from Tokugawa and Yokoyama-jo Castle.

A theory suggests that Asai and Asakura troops, which were outnumbered by Oda's, provoked a night attack against Oda troops and were backing away from them, but they made the enemy retreat with the back-up troops from Tokugawa and Yokoyama-jo Castle.

sen.j: 信長が姉川の合戦後員昌の離間に心血を注いでいたことから員昌に手を焼かされたとみる説。
sen.e: A theory suggests that because there was the fact that Nobunaga devoted himself to estrange Kazumasa after the Battle of Anegawa, he had trouble with Kazumasa.
A theory suggests that because there was the fact that Nobunaga devoted himself to estrange Kazumasa after the Battle of Anegawa, he had trouble with Kazumasa.
A theory suggests that because there was the fact that Nobunaga devoted himself to estrange Kazumasa after the Battle of Anegawa, he had trouble with Kazumasa.

sen.j: 姉川の合戦の戦況に関する織田家の史料は簡潔な記述にとどまっていることから真実は定かではない。
sen.e: Because historical materials on the situation of the battle that the Oda clan has had provide only brief descriptions, the truth is unknown.
Because historical materials on the situation of the battle that the Oda clan has had provide only brief descriptions, the truth is unknown.
Because historical materials on the situation of the battle that the Oda clan has had provide only brief descriptions, the truth is unknown.

sen.j: 姉川の合戦における浅井家の被害は甚大で、長政が最も信頼していたと言われている重臣遠藤直経や長政の実弟浅井政之をはじめ、弓削家澄、今村氏直ら浅井家で中心的役割を果たしていた多くの武将が戦死した。
sen.e: The damage caused by the battle was so devastating that a number of samurais who played the central role in the Asai clan such as a senior vassal Naotsune ENDO, whom Nagamasa was believed to have trusted the most, Nagamasa's own younger brother Masayuki ASAI, Iezumi YUGE and the Imamura clan were killed.

The damage caused by the battle was so devastating that a number of samurais who played the central role in the Azai clan such as a senior vassal Naotsune ENDO, whom, they say, Nagamasa had trusted the most, Nagamasa's own younger brother Masayuki AZAI, Iezumi YUGE and the Imamura clan were killed.
sen.cmt: Asai → Azai whom Nagamasa was believed to have trusted → whom, they say, Nagamasa had trusted に修正しました。
sen.e: The damage caused by the battle was so devastating that a number of samurais who played the central role in the Azai clan such as a senior vassal Naotsune ENDO, whom, they say, Nagamasa had trusted the most, Nagamasa's own younger brother Masayuki AZAI, Iezumi YUGE and the Imamura clan were killed.

sen.j: その後、浅井朝倉連合軍は延暦寺の僧兵衆や一向一揆と手を結び、湖西の志賀郡などで激しい攻防戦が繰り返された。
sen.e: Later, the allied forces of Asai and Asakura partnered with warrior monks of Enryaku-ji Temple and uprisings of Ikko sect followers and repeated fierce battles in the region such as Shiga-gun, Kosai.
Later, the allied forces of Aｚai and Asakura partnered with warrior monks of Enryaku-ji Temple and uprisings of Ikko sect followers and repeated fierce battles in the region such as Shiga-gun, Kosai.
Later, the allied forces of Aｚai and Asakura partnered with warrior monks of Enryaku-ji Temple and uprisings of Ikko sect followers and repeated fierce battles in the region such as Shiga-gun, Kosai.

sen.j: これらの戦いでは織田方の被害も決して軽微なものとはいえず、信長の実弟織田信治をはじめ森可成・坂井政尚などの古参諸将を失った。
sen.e: In these battles, the damage which Oda side suffered with never be minor one, and senior warlords including Nobunaga's younger brother Nobuharu ODA, Yoshinari MORI and Masanao SAKAI were killed.
In these battles, the damage at Oda side was not minor one, and senior warlords including Nobunaga's younger brother Nobuharu ODA, Yoshinari MORI and Masanao SAKAI were killed.
In these battles, the damage at Oda side was not minor one, and senior warlords including Nobunaga's younger brother Nobuharu ODA, Yoshinari MORI and Masanao SAKAI were killed.

sen.j: 業を煮やした信長は浅井・朝倉を支持する比叡山焼き討ち (1571年)するなど、周辺敵勢力の掃討に打って出た。
sen.e: Nobunaga, who was exasperated at such losses at the battle, decided to wipe out enemy powers nearby by carrying out the fire attack (in 1571) against Mt. Hiei which supported Asai and Asakura.
sen.cmt: 「業を煮やした」は何に対してかなのか書いていないが、前文からの続きと読み、兵（古参将）を失ったこととした。
sen.e: Nobunaga, who was exasperated at such losses at the battle, decided to wipe out enemy powers nearby by carrying out the fire attack (in 1571) against Mt. Hiei which supported Aｚai and Asakura.
Nobunaga, who was exasperated at such losses at the battle, decided to wipe out enemy powers nearby by carrying out the fire attack (in 1571) against Mt. Hiei which supported Aｚai and Asakura.

sen.j: また、軍事力だけでは攻略は困難と判断した信長は諜略によって浅井家の内部分裂を謀った。
sen.e: Nobunaga, who decided that it would be hard to capture the enemies only with forces, framed a conspiracy to cause internal divisions in the Asai clan.
Nobunaga, who decided that it would be hard to capture the enemies only with forces, framed a conspiracy to cause internal divisions in the Aｚai clan.
Nobunaga, who decided that it would be hard to capture the enemies only with forces, framed a conspiracy to cause internal divisions in the Aｚai clan.

sen.j: その代表例が姉川の合戦で最も武功をあげた磯野員昌の離間である。
sen.e: A typical example was the estrangement of Kazumasa ISONO, who made the greatest military contributions in the Battle of Anegawa.
A typical example was the estrangement of Kazumasa ISONO, who made the greatest military contributions in the Battle of Anegawa.
A typical example was the estrangement of Kazumasa ISONO, who made the greatest military contributions in the Battle of Anegawa.

sen.j: 姉川の合戦により領国が南北に分断されてしまっていたため犬上郡の佐和山城を守備する磯野員昌らは孤立してしまい物資の補給すらままならない状態であった。
sen.e: Because the feudal lords' territories had been divided from north to south due to the battle, warriors including Kazumasa ISONO, who guarded Sawayama-jo Castle in Inukami-gun, became isolated and had a hard time even receiving goods.

Because the feudal lords' territories had been divided from north to south due to the battle, warriors including Kazumasa ISONO, who guarded Sawayama-jo Castle in Inukami-gun, became isolated and had a hard time even receiving goods.

Because the feudal lords' territories had been divided from north to south due to the battle, warriors including Kazumasa ISONO, who guarded Sawayama-jo Castle in Inukami-gun, became isolated and had a hard time even receiving goods.

sen.j: そこに目をつけた秀吉が浅井家家中に員昌内通の風説を流し、長政らに員昌に対する疑念をもたせることに成功した。
sen.e: Hideyoshi, who had an eye on that situation, spread a rumor to the members of the Asai clan that Kazumasa was a betrayer, and succeeded in making Nagamasa and others having suspicion against Kazumasa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Hideyoshi, who had an eye on that situation, spread a rumor to the members of the Aｚai clan that Kazumasa was a betrayer, and succeeded in making Nagamasa and others having suspicion against Kazumasa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処OKAsai → Azai
sen.e: Hideyoshi, who had an eye on that situation, spread a rumor to the members of the Aｚai clan that Kazumasa was a betrayer, and succeeded in making Nagamasa and others having suspicion against Kazumasa.

sen.j: 長政は再三にわたる員昌からの物資補給の要請をすべて拒絶し、兵糧が残り少なくなった員昌はついに織田方に投降し浅井滅亡の流れを決定付けることとなった。
sen.e: Because Nagamasa rejected all of the repeated requests for supplies of goods from Kazumasa, Kazumasa's military provisions ran low and finally surrendered to Oda side, which determined the course of the collapse of the Asai clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Because Nagamasa rejected all of the repeated requests for supplies of goods from Kazumasa, Kazumasa's military provisions ran low and finally surrendered to Oda side, which determined the course of the collapse of the Azai clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処OKAsai → Azai
sen.e: Because Nagamasa rejected all of the repeated requests for supplies of goods from Kazumasa, Kazumasa's military provisions ran low and finally surrendered to Oda side, which determined the course of the collapse of the Azai clan.

sen.j: 浅井方と見られる土塁など野村町地域に残っている。
sen.e: The mound which seems to belong to the Asai clan has remained in Nomura-cho region.
The mound which seems to belong to the Azai clan has remained in Nomura-cho region.
The mound which seems to belong to the Azai clan has remained in Nomura-cho region.

sen.j: 秀吉が、お市他三人の娘を助け出す際にかくまったとされる小谷城近くの地主の家に大岡という姓をあたえた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi gave the family name Ooka to a landlord family living near Odani-jo Castle who sheltered Oichi and other three girls upon their rescue.
Hideyoshi gave the family name Ooka to a landlord family living near Odani-jo Castle who sheltered Oichi and other three girls upon their rescue.
Hideyoshi gave the family name Ooka to a landlord family living near Odani-jo Castle who sheltered Oichi and other three girls upon their rescue.
